p: Some EOs showed a potential anticancer activity against liver, lung, colon, and prostate cancer such as Artemisia lavandulaefolia DC and its main single constituent 1,8-cineole against a subline of the ubiquitous KERATIN-forming tumour cell line HeLa which derived from an epidermal carcinoma of the mouth [ 62]. Jayaprakasha et al. (2013) [ 63] found that C. limettioides Tan EO inhibited colon cancer (SW480) by inducing the cells-apoptosis. Zu et al. (2010) [ 64] noted that the T. vulgaris EO exhibited the strongest cytotoxicity towards three human cancers: PC-3 from human prostate, A549 from human lung, and MCF-7 from breast adenocarcinoma.
